Article Title: Authors sue Amazon-backed Anthropic, claiming the company has "built a multibillion-dollar business by stealing….”
Article Text:
What the authors claim

What Anthropic said

Amazon-backed artificial intelligence company Anthropic has been sued by three authors who claim that the company has misused their books and others to train its AI-powered chatbot Claude. The authors, as reported by Reuters, have filed a class-action lawsuit against Anthropic in California.The lawsuit requests an unspecified amount of monetary damages and an order permanently blocking Anthropic from misusing the authors' work.Writers and journalists Andrea Bartz, Charles Graeber and Kirk Wallace Johnson filed the lawsuit on Tuesday. The authors said in their complaint that Anthropic has "built a multibillion-dollar business by stealing hundreds of thousands of copyrighted books."They said that Anthropic used pirated versions of their works and others to teach Claude to respond to human prompts. They claim that ClaudeAI was trained on dataset called “The Pile” that includes a significant portion called Books3 - a collection of pirated ebooks from popular authors such as Stephen King and Michael Poll.“Just like the developers of other technologies that have come before, from the printing press to the copy machine to the web-crawler, AI companies must follow the law,” the authors demanded,” the authors demanded.The report quotes an Anthropic spokesperson who said that the company was aware of the lawsuit and assessing the complaint. However, the spokesperson declined to comment further, citing pending litigation.This is not the first case where a lawsuit has been filed against a tech company over alleged misuse of copyright data to train AI models . Separate groups of authors have sued OpenAI and Meta Platforms over the companies' alleged misuse of their work to train the large-language models underlying their chatbots.
Article Summary: Writers and journalists Andrea Bartz, Charles Graeber and Kirk Wallace Johnson filed the lawsuit on Tuesday. The authors said in their complaint that Anthropic has "built a multibillion-dollar business by stealing hundreds of thousands of copyrighted books" Anthropic spokesperson said that the company was aware of the lawsuit and assessing the complaint.

Article Title: Google is bringing this iPhone-like feature on Chrome for Android, PC
Article Text:
What’s in it for users

Google making Chrome secure during screen sharing

Google has announced that it is making the process of accessing passwords and bookmarks easier on Chrome on Android and desktop. Launched previously for Chrome for iPhones, the feature will make bringing all the saved data on your Chrome browser to the device you log in without having you to enable the Chrome sync toggle.“From the point of signing in to Chrome you’ll get access to your saved passwords, addresses, and other data from your Google Account.Where relevant, we’ll offer you the choice to sign into Chrome for a customised browsing experience on any device,” Google said.This feature will not only make the process of accessing data across multiple devices easier but also provide better cross-device functionality.For example, you can work on your PC on Chrome and start reading a long news story. But suddenly you have to be on a move. You can finish reading the article on your phone, send tabs between devices, find bookmarks and use autogenerated passwords with ease.“As always, you have control - we strive to provide an excellent browser experience regardless of whether you choose to sign in or not. Additionally, saving your history and open tabs to your account remains a separate opt-in after signing into Chrome,” Google said.As per the company, since the digital landscape has undergone a transformation over the past decade, its users now expect easier access to their data and services across multiple devices and Google’s this feature is to align with these evolving user expectations.Recently, a report said that Google is taking steps to bolster user privacy on Android devices by introducing a new feature in Chrome. This feature will automatically redact (or remove) sensitive information, such as credit card numbers and passwords, during screen sharing and recording sessions.This enhancement aims to prevent accidental exposure of personal data, addressing a potential security vulnerability.
Article Summary: Google has announced that it is making the process of accessing passwords and bookmarks easier on Chrome on Android and desktop. Launched previously for Chrome for iPhones, the feature will make bringing all the saved data on your Chrome browser to the device you log in.

Article Title: Cisco confirms job cuts, but why the 'painful suspense' continues for employees
Article Text:
"Most toxic environment"

"Job cuts not about profitability"

Cisco's second round of layoffs this year has sent shockwaves through the company. While the company has confirmed the job cuts in an SEC filing last week, employees reportedly continue to face weeks of uncertainty about their fate. According to multiple Cisco employees who spoke with TechCrunch, the PC giant has delayed informing affected employees until September 16.In the SEC filing last week, Cisco said that it is cutting 7% of its workforce. The cuts will reduce Cisco’s headcount of 90,400 by about 7% — indicating a loss of more than 6,300 jobs. The move will reportedly bring short-term costs of about $1 billion, Cisco said. It also has been digesting the purchase of Splunk Inc, which it acquired earlier this year.“This has become the most toxic environment I’ve ever worked in,” one anonymous Cisco employee told TechCrunch. "Two layoffs of this magnitude in the same calendar year is beyond the pale."The news follows an earlier round of layoffs in February that impacted around 4,000 employees. In February this year, Cisco Systems said that it would cut 5% of its global workforce and lowered its annual revenue target as the company navigates a tough economy.In an interview to Bloomberg, Scott Herren, Cisco's Chief Financial Officer, said that job cuts are not about trying to boost profits. He added that Cisco needs to rapidly shift further into cybersecurity, cloud systems and artificial intelligence-related products, so it’s freeing up resources to do that.In a statement, Cisco’s chair and CEO Chuck Robbins, said the company plans to further integrate Splunk into its products. It will also combine its networking, security and collaboration departments into one organization led by Jeetu Patel, Robbins said. Jonathan Davidson, Cisco Networking’s general manager and executive vice president, will become an adviser to Robbins.
Article Summary: Cisco has confirmed that it is cutting 7% of its workforce. The cuts will reduce Cisco’s headcount of 90,400 by about 7% — indicating a loss of more than 6,300 jobs. The move will reportedly bring short-term costs of about $1 billion. The news follows an earlier round of layoffs in February.

Article Title: Why what the US watched in July is important for Netflix, Amazon and Walt Disney
Article Text:
Why these numbers matters

Beyond the Olympics

What all stood out in July

Streaming services continue to dominate TV viewership in the US, reaching a record 41.4% share in July, according to Nielsen's latest Gauge report. The Nielsen Gauge report unveils TV viewing trends of the US audience across platforms and distributors. According to a report in Reuters, quoting the Nielsen's report, this growth is largely attributed to the highly anticipated Paris Olympics and the ongoing US presidential election campaign.The record-breaking viewership numbers on streaming platforms paint a clear picture: audiences are increasingly abandoning cable. This trend is reflected in the declining cable share, which dropped to 26.7% in July.Traditional media giants like Netflix , Amazon , and Disney are recognizing the shifting consumer preference and investing heavily in sports content. Securing broadcasting rights for major events like the Olympics has become a key strategy to attract younger viewers.While the Olympics sparked the surge, cable news also saw a significant boost (52%) due to the Republican National Convention and the shocking news of an assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump .* Comcast's Peacock led the pack with a 33% jump in monthly usage, fueled by Olympics coverage and popular shows like "Love Island USA."* Google-owned YouTube became the first platform to surpass 10% of total TV usage (10% in July vs. 9.9% in June).* "House of the Dragon" on HBO Max emerged as the most-watched program with 4.7 billion viewing minutes, followed by "Bluey" on Disney+ (4.3 billion) and "The Boys" on Amazon Prime (4.2 billion).The Future of TV:* Other streamers that performed well include Amazon.com's Amazon Prime Video and Roku Channel.
Article Summary: Streaming services continue to dominate TV viewership in the US, reaching a record 41.4% share in July. Comcast's Peacock led the pack with a 33% jump in monthly usage, fueled by Olympics coverage and popular shows like "Love Island USA" Google-owned YouTube became the first platform to surpass 10% of total TV usage.

Article Title: Elon Musk's Tesla needs you to train its humanoid robot ‘Optimus’ to move like a human
Article Text:
Tesla is hiring data collection operators

Job requirements and responsibilities

Height requirement : Applicants need to be between 5'7" and 5'11" tall, which likely aligns with the optimal height range for simulating the movements of the humanoid robot.

: Applicants need to be between 5'7" and 5'11" tall, which likely aligns with the optimal height range for simulating the movements of the humanoid robot. Endurance : The role requires individuals to wear a VR headset for extended periods, sometimes seven hours or more, which can be disorienting. This aspect of the job tests the resilience and physical adaptability of the candidates.

: The role requires individuals to wear a VR headset for extended periods, sometimes seven hours or more, which can be disorienting. This aspect of the job tests the resilience and physical adaptability of the candidates. Physical tasks: Operators must perform various tasks while wearing motion capture suits, such as walking on test routes and carrying 30-pound weights. These activities are designed to replicate common human movements and interactions with objects.

Evolution of Tesla's humanoid robot: Optimus

Introduction of Bumblebee

Optimus: A glimpse into the future

Production plans and future applications

Role of motion capture and VR in robot development

VR headsets for immersive simulation

Also read

Tesla, the innovative company led by Elon Musk , is pushing the boundaries of robotics by developing its humanoid robot, Optimus. In an effort to make these robots move more like humans, Tesla is employing people to wear motion capture suits and virtual reality (VR) headsets. This initiative aims to gather essential data to refine the movement capabilities of Optimus, ensuring that it can navigate and perform tasks in a way that closely mimics human behaviour.To achieve the goal of human-like movement for its robots, Tesla has recruited over 50 individuals as “Data Collection Operators,” according to a report by Business Insider. These operators play a crucial role in the development of Optimus by providing the necessary data that engineers and developers use to enhance the robot’s performance.The position of a Data Collection Operator is quite specific in terms of requirements:The data gathered from these activities is critical for programming the robot’s movements, allowing Optimus to perform tasks with increased precision and fluidity. The job offers competitive pay, ranging from $25 to $48 per hour, along with bonuses, stocks, and additional benefits, making it an attractive position for those interested in the cutting-edge field of robotics.Tesla’s journey into humanoid robotics began with a bold announcement by Elon Musk during the company’s AI Day event in 2021. Musk introduced the concept of a humanoid robot that would leverage Tesla’s advancements in artificial intelligence (AI) and autonomous systems, with the potential to revolutionise industries ranging from manufacturing to personal assistance.In 2022, Tesla unveiled its first humanoid robot prototype, named Bumblebee. This prototype marked a significant milestone in Tesla’s robotics program. During its first public demonstration, Bumblebee was able to walk onto the stage and wave to the audience, showcasing its bipedal mobility. A demonstration video further highlighted its capabilities, showing Bumblebee picking up and moving boxes in an office environment. This demonstration served as proof of concept, indicating that Tesla was on the right track in developing a functional humanoid robot.Building on the success of Bumblebee, Tesla continued to develop and refine its humanoid robot, Optimus. Earlier this year, Elon Musk revealed that two Optimus robots were already working autonomously at one of Tesla’s factories. This milestone demonstrated the robot’s potential to contribute to industrial operations, showcasing its ability to perform repetitive and physically demanding tasks without human intervention.Elon Musk’s vision for Optimus extends beyond Tesla’s internal operations. In July, he announced on X (formerly Twitter) that Tesla plans to have “genuinely useful humanoid robots in low production for Tesla internal use next year.” He further expressed optimism about ramping up production for external companies by 2026. This timeline indicates Tesla’s commitment to not only perfecting the robot’s capabilities but also making it commercially viable.If successful, Optimus could have a transformative impact on various industries. Its potential applications are vast, ranging from automating labor-intensive tasks in factories to providing personal assistance in homes. The integration of AI and robotics could lead to significant efficiency gains, cost savings, and improved safety in environments that are hazardous or difficult for humans to operate in.The use of motion capture and VR technology is pivotal in training Optimus to move like a human. Motion capture suits allow Tesla to record the precise movements of the Data Collection Operators, capturing details such as joint angles, stride lengths, and balance shifts. This data is then fed into algorithms that guide the robot’s movements, enabling it to replicate human-like motion with greater accuracy.The VR headsets worn by operators create an immersive environment that simulates various scenarios in which Optimus might operate. By exposing the robot to these simulations, Tesla can fine-tune its responses to different tasks and environments, ensuring that Optimus can perform a wide range of activities with minimal errors. This combination of motion capture and VR technology represents a cutting-edge approach to robot training, setting the stage for more advanced and capable robots in the future.Tesla’s efforts to develop a humanoid robot like Optimus have far-reaching implications. Beyond its immediate applications in manufacturing and personal assistance, the success of Optimus could pave the way for broader adoption of humanoid robots across multiple sectors. Industries such as healthcare, logistics, and construction could benefit from robots capable of performing complex tasks with human-like dexterity and precision.Moreover, the data collection and motion analysis methods being employed by Tesla could lead to advancements in AI and robotics that extend beyond the realm of humanoid robots. The knowledge gained from this project could contribute to the development of other robotic systems, autonomous vehicles, and AI-driven technologies.
Article Summary: Tesla is hiring data collection operators for its humanoid robot, Optimus. Applicants need to be between 5'7" and 5'11" tall, which likely aligns with the optimal height range for simulating the movements of the humanoid robot. Operators must perform various tasks while wearing motion capture suits, such as walking on test routes and carrying 30-pound weights. The data gathered from these activities is critical for programming the robot’s movements, allowing Optimus to perform tasks with increased precision and fluidity.

Article Title: What Airtel, Reliance Jio and Vodafone-Idea 'want' for WhatsApp, Signal, Telegram, Google, other OTT apps is violation of the Indian Constitution as ...
Article Text:
"Telecom companies demand unconstitutional"

What Reliance Jio, Airtel and Vodafone said in their submission to TRAI

Another big fight is brewing between telecom operators -- Airtel, Reliance Jio and Vodafone-Idea -- and internet giants over the regulation of over-the-top (OTT) platforms. Telecom industry body COAI has called for bringing popular messaging and video call apps like WhatsApp , Telegram , and Google Meet under the ambit of telecom licences, arguing that they contribute significantly to data traffic and infrastructure costs.COAI members include Airtel, Reliance Jio, Vodafone-Idea and BSNL. However, the Broadband India Forum (BIF) has vehemently opposed this move, claiming it's discriminatory and unconstitutional. BIF members include Google, Microsoft, WhatsApp, Facebook and others.Industry body BIF has claimed that telecom service providers' -- Airtel, Reliance Jio and Vodafone-Idea -- suggestion to bring internet call and messaging apps like WhatsApp, Telegram, and Google Meet under the ambit of telecom licences is in violation of the Constitution of India. In a statement, BIF president TV Ramachandran said that bringing OTT (over-the-top) services under the Telecom Act is in complete violation of Article 14 of the Constitution, which guarantees equal treatment to every person and entity."Comparing OTT services to telecom services of voice and SMS is completely erroneous and overlooks the vast and critical differences between the two categories," Ramachandran said. He asserted that OTT services are fundamentally different from traditional telecom services, as they don't own network infrastructure or enjoy the same spectrum rights.He said telecom service providers enjoy several exclusive and unique rights that include the right to interference-free spectrum, numbering resources, right of way to set up infrastructure etc. However, OTT players neither have these privileges nor do they own the network or control the access to telecom infrastructure.In response to the “Introduction of a Unified-Service Pan India Authorization” BIF said that different types of services require different terms and conditions and a single authorisation ignoring thedifferent types of telecommunication services and ignoring different terms and conditions attached to each type of telecommunication services will be completely arbitrary and will greatly damage the regulatory framework. It will be in violation of the framework given in Section 3(1) and Section 3(2) of the Telecommunications Act, 2023 and level playing field, which will be changed in favour of few and against others.Reliance Jio, Bharti Airtel, Vodafone Idea and industry body COAI -- in their comments on the consultation paper issued by Trai, seeking views on the framework for service authorisations to be granted under the Telecommunications Act, 2023 -- have said that the calling and messaging apps should be brought under services to be provided through authorisation."As per our understanding, OTT Communication services are covered under the new Telecom Act as an access service," Telecom operators industry body COAI said in its submission to the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (Trai).
Article Summary: Telecom industry body COAI has called for bringing popular messaging and video call apps like WhatsApp under the ambit of telecom licences. Broadband India Forum (BIF) has vehemently opposed this move, claiming it's discriminatory and unconstitutional. BIF members include Google, Microsoft, WhatsApp, Facebook and others.

Article Title: Toyota confirms breach after hacker exposes 240GB data; read the company’s message
Article Text:
"We are aware of the situation. The issue is limited in scope and is not a system wide issue,"





The hacker behind Toyota data breach



"We have hacked a branch in the United States of one of the biggest automotive manufacturers in the world (TOYOTA). We are really glad to share the files with you here for free. The data size: 240 GB. Contents: Everything like Contacts, Finance, Customers, Schemes, Employees, Photos, DBs, Network infrastructure, Emails, and a lot of perfect data. We also offer you AD-Recon for all the target networks with passwords."

Toyota’s battles against data breach



Toyota has recently confirmed that the company’s data has been exposed by a breach. This announcement came after an attacker group reportedly claimed to have leaked an archive of 240GB of data stolen from the Japanese car maker’s systems on a hacking forum.Toyota told BleepingComputer validating the hacker group’s claims.The company added that it's "engaged with those who are impacted and will provide assistance if needed.” However, Toyota didn’t provide details about when it discovered the breach, how the attackers gained access and how many people have had their data exposed in the incident.According to a report by Bleeping Computer, a hacker group named ZeroSevenGroup was responsible for leaking the data stolen from Toyota. The attackers said that they breached a US branch of the carmaker and were able to steal 240GB of files with information on Toyota employees and customers, as well as contracts and financial information,The hackers also claimed to have collected network infrastructure information, including credentials, using the open-source ADRecon tool that helps extract large amounts of information from Active Directory environments.In a statement to Bleeping Computer, the hacker group claimed:The report also speculated that the files had been stolen or at least created in December 2022. This suggests that the attackers gained access to a backup server where the company stored its data.In 2023, Toyota Financial Services (TFS) disclosed two significant data breaches which included a misconfigured cloud database that exposed the car-location information of 2.15 million customers for ten years along with a ransomware attack on Toyota's European and African divisions that compromised sensitive personal and financial data.In response to these incidents, Toyota implemented an automated system to monitor and prevent future data leaks.
Article Summary: Toyota has confirmed that the company’s data has been exposed by a breach. This announcement came after an attacker group reportedly claimed to have leaked an archive of 240GB of data stolen from the Japanese car maker's systems on a hacking forum. The attackers said that they breached a US branch of the carmaker and were able to steal 240GB.

Article Title: Google launches Pixel 9 Pro Fold, it’s first-ever foldable phone in India
Article Text:
Pixel 9 Pro Fold has bigger and brighter displays

Tensor G4, Gemini and more AI inside

Upgraded cameras with the new 'Add me' AI feature for photos

Google has launched its second-generation Pixel foldable phone, the Pixel 9 Pro Fold , which is its first-ever foldable phone in India. The second-gen Pixel Fold upgrades on some salient aspects over the first one. Per Google, the foldable is slim, super durable, and has a brighter screen, both on the outside and inside. And, the phone also packs in Pixel’s “fastest, most powerful” Tensor G4 chip , bringing on-device multimodal capabilities to the phone.On the inside, the Pixel 9 Pro Fold comes equipped with an 8 inches ‘Super Actua Flex display,’ an LTPO panel with a 2922x1344 resolution at 486 PPI. The inner screen has a dynamic refresh rate of 1-120Hz and can go as bright as 3,000 nits, which Google says is 80% brighter than the screen on the first-gen Pixel Fold. To make use of phone’s large inner canvas, there’s a split-screen mode that’ll let you use two apps side-by-side.When unfolded, the Pixel 9 Pro Fold can be used a regular phone with a 6.3 inches outer screen, which has the same specs as the inner screen.Google says that the Pixel 9 Pro Fold has an “all-new” hinge that is made from stainless steel and has an aerospace grade aluminium alloy cover. The hinge has a polished finish, while the back has the silky matt finish. The phone is rated IPX8 for water resistivity. And there’s Gorilla Glass Victus 2 on the outside.Powering the Pixel 9 Pro Fold is Google’s Tensor G4 chip, also found on the other three Pixel 9 phones. The chip comes paired with 16GB of RAM and up to 1TB storage. Then, there’s theTitan M2 security coprocessor , which enables multi-layer hardware security.There’s a 5,060mAh battery, which Google promises will last for over 24 hours and up to 100 hours with Extreme Battery Saver. The phone supports fast charging at 45W, which should fill up the battery up to 55% in about 30 minutes. FYI, the charger isn’t included in the box. The phone also supports Qi wireless charging and Battery Share, i.e., reverse wireless charging.Out-of-the-box the Pixel 9 Pro Fold will come with Android 14 . There’s the usual Google promise of 7 years of OS and security updates.Would it even be a Pixel phone, if there’s no AI in it. Well, there’s a whole lot of AI. For starters Gemini is there, and it works in split-screen mode, as well. One could ask Gemini to write stuff or even get info about whats’s on the screen or photos. Circle To Search is also there, ohh and this feature can help you check if an image has been created using AI.The new “Pixel-exclusive” AI feature to arrive is Pixel Screenshots. The feature could organise or recall things, like events and location, all you need to is ask the phone.Google is giving one year of the Google One AI Premium plan for free to those who’ll buy the Pixel 9 Pro Fold. So, that’ll give you access to Gemini Advanced, Gemini in Gmail and Docs, on top of 2TB of cloud storage.The Pixel 9 Pro Fold ditches the camera visor for a squircle module that houses a triple lens setup – a 50MP wide camera, a 48MP ultraide and a 48MP 5x telephoto camera. For selfies, there's a 42 MP front-facing camera on the inner screen and 10MP camera on the outside.The camera hardware has been only a part of Pixel’s camera, but it’s AI that completes it. There’s a long list of AI features that complements the camera hardware on the Pixel 9 Pro Fold. The usual Super Res Zoom, Zoom Enhance, Video Boost, Face Unblur, Photo Unblur, Best Take, Magic Eraser, Audio Eraser, and Magic Editor makes their return. Well, Magic Eraser now has an a “reimagine” feature that Google says can give photos a “whole new look.”One new AI tool to come to Google’s Pixel 9 pro Fold is the “Add Me,” which as you’d image can add you to a picture. So, how does it work? Well, you take photo with the group, swap in yourself, and AI will merge the photos.Google Pixel 9 Pro Fold is priced in India at Rs 1,72,999 and will be available for purchase later this year. While it comes in two colours – Obsidian and Porcelain – it’ll be available only in Obsidian colour in India.
Article Summary: Google has launched its second-generation Pixel foldable phone, the Pixel 9 Pro Fold. The second-gen Pixel Fold upgrades on some salient aspects over the first one. Per Google, the foldable is slim, super durable, and has a brighter screen, both on the outside and inside. And, the phone also packs in Pixel’s “fastest, most powerful” Tensor G4 chip.

Article Title: General Motors lays off over 1,000 employees, including hundreds of software engineers; says “grateful to …
Article Text:
Job cuts come after the change of leadership

GM recently faced a few software incidents

General Motors is laying off more than 1,000 salaried employees globally in its software and services division, the company confirmed on Monday. The job cuts , which include about 600 positions at GM's tech campus near Detroit, come as part of a review to streamline operations in the unit."As we build GM's future, we must simplify for speed and excellence, make bold choices, and prioritise the investments that will have the greatest impact," GM said in a statement to CNBC.The layoffs represent approximately 1.3% of GM's global salaried workforce of 76,000 as of the end of last year. The cuts primarily affect the automaker's US operations. Impacted employees were notified Monday morning."We are grateful to those who helped establish a strong foundation that positions GM to lead moving forward," the automaker added in its statement."As a result, we're reducing certain teams within the Software and Services organisation," GM stated. The division, currently led by executives Baris Cetinok and Dave Richardson, covers areas such as vehicle infotainment, OnStar services, and GM's Super Cruise advanced driver-assist system.The change comes less than six months after leadership shifts in the unit, including the departure of former Apple executive Mike Abbott in March due to health reasons.The job cuts follow GM's efforts to reduce costs amid industry concerns of a potential downturn and significant investments in electric vehicles and software-defined vehicles. GM has recently faced challenges with software issues in its new Chevy Blazer EV, including blank infotainment screens and charging error messages. The company issued a stop sale notice last December due to these problems, which was lifted in March.The layoffs also come after GM cancelled its "Ultra Cruise" programme, a competitor to Tesla's Full Self-Driving system, in January. The company merged the FSD team with its regular Super Cruise team.Despite the layoffs and recent setbacks, the company says it continues to work on expanding its hands-free driving system, with plans to broaden its capabilities by the end of 2025.
Article Summary: GM is laying off more than 1,000 salaried employees globally in its software and services division. The job cuts come as part of a review to streamline operations in the unit. The layoffs represent approximately 1.3% of GM's global workforce of 76,000.

Article Title: Elon Musk reacts to ‘DOGE’ post about Donald Trump’s cabinet offer: Perfect name
Article Text: Former President Donald Trump mentioned he would consider Elon Musk for a significant role in his administration if re-elected. Musk reacted positively to a social media post suggesting he head the 'Department Of Government Efficiency (DOGE)'.
Article Summary: Former President Donald Trump mentioned he would consider Elon Musk for a significant role in his administration if re-elected. Musk reacted positively to a social media post suggesting he head the 'Department Of Government Efficiency (DOGE)’ He said he would be 'honoured' to be considered.

Article Title: Kerala woman loses Rs 12 lakh to custom fraud: Government shares biggest tip to spot such online custom frauds
Article Text:
How the scammers operate

What can you do in case of custom fraud

Scammers keep finding new ways to trap people and steal money from their bank accounts. One of the most prevalent scams circulating today is the 'Customs Fraud'. This deceptive scheme involves fraudsters posing as customs officials, demanding payments for fictitious packages or parcels held in customs.A woman from Kerala recently fell prey to a custom fraud incurring a loss of Rs 12 lakh.The ordeal began when the woman received a call demanding Rs 15,000 as customs duty for a gift she was allegedly expecting. Believing the caller to be a genuine customs official, she paid the amount. However, the demands escalated as the fraudsters claimed to have discovered higher-value items in the parcel, including dollars worth Rs 10 lakh. The victim continued to pay as instructed, only to realise the scam when a friend alerted her.The government’s fact-checking division, ‘ PIB Fact Check ,’ recently issued a warning to internet users about Customs-related fraud through a post on X. The post features a video demonstrating how scammers deceive people, accompanied by a voice clip detailing the criminals’ tactics in these scams. It also provides essential guidelines to help individuals protect themselves from falling victim to such schemes.For those unaware, PIB Fact Check, as the name implies, checks for fake news and misinformation related to the Government of India.In the voice clip shared, scammers impersonate an officer from the Indian Customs department when they call their target. The call begins with a pre-recorded message, claiming there’s an issue with a parcel the target was sending online, or that the package contains something illegal.The message then prompts the user to press “9” for more details or support. Once “9” is pressed, the call connects to a representative who also pretends to be from the Customs department.Typically, the scammers attempt to intimidate or blackmail the target by alleging illegal contents in the package or demanding payment under the guise of taxes. This is where the scam unfolds.First and foremost, confirm whether you or anyone in your family has actually sent a courier. If not, it's best to ignore the call. To be extra cautious, you can verify any communication from Indian Customs using the Document Identification Number (DIN) on CBIC's website.Additionally, avoid clicking on any links sent to your phone, no matter how genuine they appear. Refrain from sharing any personal information over the call, as scammers can use that information to trap you further.Finally, be sure to report the incident to your local police or the Cyber Crime department.
Article Summary: A woman from Kerala recently fell prey to a custom fraud incurring a loss of Rs 12 lakh. The ordeal began when the woman received a call demanding Rs 15,000 as customs duty for a gift she was allegedly expecting. However, the demands escalated as the fraudsters claimed to have discovered higher-value items in the parcel, including dollars worth Rs 10 lakh.

Article Title: Apple re-releases iOS 17.6.1 that fixes this important security issue on iPhones
Article Text:
How to install iOS 17.6.1

Apple has released an updated version of iOS 17.6.1 . The update comes almost 10 days after the company first released iOS 17.6.1. The latest release has a build number of 21G101. It brings a fix for an issue that prevented users from enabling or disabling Advanced Data Protection .To install the iOS 17.6.1 update on your iPhone , head to Settings. Here, tap on General and then tap on ‘Software Update’.As per Apple release notes, “This update includes important bug fixes and addresses an issue that prevents enabling or disabling Advanced Data Protection”.Apple explains: “Advanced Data Protection is designed to maintain end-to-end encryption for shared content as long as all participants have Advanced Data Protection enabled. This level of protection is supported in most iCloud sharing features, including iCloud Shared Photo Library, iCloud Drive shared folders and shared Notes.”It must be noted here that the Advanced Data Protection bug impacted a small number of iPhone users . Due to the bug, those enabling the Advanced Data Protection feature were seeing an error message, although it was turned on in the iCloud data.In a separate news, Apple has rolled out the fourth public beta of iOS 18. The release comes as the company nears the launch of 2024 iPhone 16 series and public roll out of iOS 18. The iOS 18 public beta 4 brings a host of new features along with some bug fixes and system stability improvements. These include bringing Bluetooth as individual control in the Control Centre, splash screens in apps like Home, Photos, Notes, and more.
Article Summary: The update comes almost 10 days after the company first released iOS 17.6.1. It brings a fix for an issue that prevented users from enabling or disabling Advanced Data Protection. In a separate news, Apple has rolled out the fourth public beta of iOS 18.

Article Title: Oppo A3 with 50MP camera, 45W fast charging launched, priced at Rs 15,999
Article Text:
Price and availability

Oppo

A3 specifications

Oppo A3 smartphone is here. Oppo has expanded its A-series of smartphones with the launch of the affordable Oppo A3 smartphone in India. The smartphone comes with military grade shock resistance and houses a 120Hz bright display. Oppo A3 comes with 45W fast charging support and runs Android 14 operating system. Oppo A3 comes with a price tag of Rs 15,999 and it can be purchased in Nebula Red and Ocean Blue colour options.The smartphone is available online on the company’s official website .Oppo A3 houses a 6.6-inch HD display with 720x1604 pixel resolution. The display offers 120Hz refresh rate and 89.9% screen-to-body ratio. The smartphone is powered by an octa-core MediaTek Dimensity 6300 chipset paired with 6GB of RAM.Oppo A3 packs 128GB internal storage which can be expanded further by installing a microSD card. The affordable Oppo smartphone runs Android 14 operating system topped with the company's own layer of ColorOS on top.The dual SIM Oppo smartphone comes with military-grade shock resistance design. The company claims that the Oppo A3 can withstand shock and drop. The smartphone also comes with multiple liquid resistance which means that the smartphone will not get damaged even if it gets in touch with different kinds of liquids.Oppo A3 sports 50MP dual rear camera setup and a 5MP front camera for selfies. The smartphone is backed by a 5,100 mAh battery which comes with 45W fast charging support.
Article Summary: Oppo A3 comes with a price tag of Rs 15,999 and it can be purchased in Nebula Red and Ocean Blue colour options. Oppo A3 houses a 6.6-inch HD display with 720x1604 pixel resolution. The smartphone is powered by an octa-core MediaTek Dimensity 6300 chipset paired with 6GB of RAM.

Article Title: GoPro lays off 15% of its workforce, affecting 140 employees
Article Text:
Job cuts to be completed by year end

Second layoff in 2024

GoPro lays off 15% of its workforce this year, reported news agency Reuters. The popular action camera maker in a SEC filing said that it plans to cut its workforce as part of a restructuring plan to reduce operating expenses.“Restructuring Plan is anticipated to entail a reduction in force of approximately 15% from our ending second quarter headcount of 925 full-time employees beginning in Q3 2024,” the company said in the filing.The layoffs are expected to begin in the third quarter of 2024 and would be completed by the end of 2024. About 140 employees will be impacted by it.As part of the restructuring plan, the company expects to take charges in the range of $5 million to $7 million, with cash expenses of $1 million to be recognized in the third quarter and about $4 million to $6 million in the fourth quarter of 2024.This is the second time GoPro has announced job cuts in 2024. The company reduced its workforce by 4% in March earlier this year.GoPro had 925 full-time employees at the end of the second quarter ended June 30.Earlier this month, GoPro reported a revenue of $186 million for the second quarter, down 22.7% compared to last year. In May, the U.S. International Trade Commission launched a probe into GoPro's claims that patents for its cameras, systems and accessories were being violated by Chinese firm Arashi Vision.The tech industry continues to see job cuts in 2024. Last week, Cisco announced it would lay off 6,000 employees. In a separate news today, General Motors laid off more than 1,000 salaried employee in its software and services division.
Article Summary: GoPro plans to cut its workforce as part of a restructuring plan to reduce operating expenses. The layoffs are expected to begin in the third quarter of 2024 and would be completed by the end of 2024. About 140 employees will be impacted by it. The company reduced its workforce by 4% in March earlier this year.

Article Title: Google Imagine-3 AI-powered “highest quality text-to-image model” is available in this country
Article Text:
How to access Imagen-3

Google paused image-generation in Gemini chatbot

Google has released Imagen 3 , the latest iteration of its text-to-image AI model, to users in the US. The AI model promises significant improvements over its predecessor and is said to be “highest quality text-to-image model” offered by the tech giant.Imagen 3, accessible through Google's AI Test Kitchen , is designed to generate images with enhanced detail and more realistic lighting.By refining its AI capabilities, Google aims to deliver even more impressive and visually appealing image creations."We introduce Imagen 3, a latent diffusion model that generates high quality images from text prompts. We describe our quality and responsibility evaluations. Imagen 3 is preferred over other state-of-the-art (SOTA) models at the time of evaluation. In addition, we discuss issues around safety and representation, as well as methods we used to minimise the potential harm of our models," the company said in a research paper last week.Imagen 3 will be available in multiple versions, each optimised for different types of tasks, from generating quick sketches to high-resolution images.“Imagen 3 is our highest quality text-to-image model, capable of generating images with even better detail, richer lighting and fewer distracting artefacts than our previous models. We’ve significantly improved Imagen 3’s ability to understand prompts, which helps the models generate a wide range of visual styles and capture small details from longer prompts,” Google said about Imagen-3 when it launched the model at Google I/O this year.If you live in the US, you can access Imagen 3 via ImageFX and Vertex AI. Those living outside the US can register for it using this link . Your email will be added to the waiting list and you will be given access when the AI model is available in your country.Earlier this year, Google Gemini Al chatbot created factually incorrect images. Google acknowledged issues, which led to the temporary suspension of its image generation capabilities. Google CEO Sundar Pichai also said that the company is developing the feature from the ground up and fixing the issues.
Article Summary: Imagen-3 is the latest version of Google's text-to-image AI model. It is available to users in the US and is designed to generate images with enhanced detail and more realistic lighting. It will be available in multiple versions optimised for different types of tasks, from generating quick sketches to high- resolution images.

Article Title: Google Pixel 9, Pixel 9 Pro, Pixel 9 Pro XL with Gemini AI launched: Price in India, specifications and more
Article Text:
Google Pixel 9, Pixel 9 Pro and Pixel 9 Pro XL price in India, availability

Google Pixel 9, Pixel 9 Pro and Pixel 9 Pro XL specifications

Google Pixel 9

Google Pixel 9 Pro

Google Pixel 9 Pro XL

Read More |

Google Pixel 9 series is now official. The tech giant has launched the Google Pixel 9 , Pixel 9 Pro and Pixel 9 Pro XL in India with a suite of AI features across productivity apps and the camera. This will be the first Pixel smartphone to run Gemini Nano multimodal AI model on device.Google Pixel 9, Pixel 9 Pro and Pixel 9 Pro XL are price start at Rs 79,999, Rs 1,09,999, and Rs 1,24,999, respectively.The smartphones will be available in four colour options. The Pixel 9 is launched in Obsidian, Porcelain, Wintergreen and Peony colour options. The Pixel 9 Pro and Pixel 9 Pro XL are launched in Obsidian, Porcelain, Hazel and Rose Quartz colours.Google Pixel 9 and Google Pixel 9 Pro XL will be available for preorder starting August 14 and will go on sale on August 22. Details about the pre-orders and availability of the Pixel 9 Pro will be available later this year. The available smartphones can be purchased from Flipkart, and Croma as well as Reliance Digital offline stores.Google Pixel 9 sports a 6.3-inch Actua display with a peak brightness of 2,700 nits. The full-HD (1080 x 2424 pixels at 422 PPI) OLED display has 20:9 aspect ratio and 60-120Hz refresh rate. The display is protected by Corning Gorilla Glass Victus 2.Under the hood is Google Tensor G4 SoC that is specially designed to handle AI and machine learning tasks. There is a Titan M2 security coprocessor, 12GB RAM and up to 256GB storage.As far as the camera is concerned, the phone gets a 50MP Octa PD wide camera with ƒ/1.68 aperture and 82-degree field of view. There is an ultrawide camera that packs a 48MP Quad PD sensor with an ultrawide lens that has ƒ/1.7 aperture and 123-degree field of view.On the front is a 10.5MP Dual PD selfie camera with autofocus, ƒ/2.2 aperture and 95-degree field of view. Other features include single-zone LDAF sensor, spectral and flicker sensor, and optical + electronic image stabilisation on the wide angle camera.Google is also bringing a bunch of AI features including: Super Res Zoom up to 8x, Add Me, Macro Focus, Night Sight, Astrophotography, Portrait Mode, Face Unblur, Long Exposure, Action Pan and Real Tone. Editing Features include Magic Editor, Magic Eraser, Best Take and Photo Unblur.The Google Pixel 9 packs a 4,700mAh battery and IP68 dust and water resistance rating. The smartphone will come preloaded with Android 14. Google is offering 7 years of OS, security, and Pixel Drop updates.Google Pixel 9 sports a 6.3-inch Super Actua display with a peak brightness of 3,000 nits and 1280 x 2856 pixels resolution. It is an LTPO OLED panel with 495 ppi, 20:9 aspect ratio and 1Hz-120Hz refresh rate. The display is protected by Corning Gorilla Glass Victus 2.The smartphone is powered by Google Tensor G4 SoC that is specially designed to handle AI and machine learning tasks. There is a Titan M2 security coprocessor, 16GB RAM and up to 512GB storage.Coming to the camera, the Pixel 9 Pro sports a 50MP Octa PD wide camera with ƒ/1.68 aperture and 82-degree field of view. There is an ultrawide camera that packs a 48MP Quad PD sensor with an ultrawide lens that has ƒ/1.7 aperture and 123-degree field of view.There is a third telephoto camera 48MP Quad PD sensor paired with a lens that has ƒ/2.8 aperture, 22-degree field-of-view, 5x optical zoom and Super Res Zoom up to 30x.On the front is a 42MP Dual PD selfie camera with autofocus, ƒ/2.2 aperture and 103-degree field of view. Other features are similar to the Pixel 9. The phone packs a 4,700mAh battery and IP68 dust and water resistance rating, will come preloaded with Android 14 and will get 7 years of OS, security, and Pixel Drop updates.The largest of the trio, Google Pixel 9 Pro XL sports a 6.8-inch Super Actua display with a peak brightness of 3,000 nits and 1344 x 2992 pixels resolution. It is an LTPO OLED panel with 486 ppi, 20:9 aspect ratio and 1Hz-120Hz refresh rate. The display is protected by Corning Gorilla Glass Victus 2.The SoC and camera specifications are the same as the Pixel 9 Pro. There is a Google Tensor G4 SoC, paired with a Titan M2 security coprocessor, 16GB RAM and up to 512GB storage. The Pixel 9 Pro XL gets a 50MP Octa PD wide camera, a 48MP Quad PD ultrawide shooter and a 48MP Quad PD telephoto camera.The phone gets a 42MP Dual PD selfie camera, packs a 5,060mAh battery and comes with IP68 dust and water resistance rating. Both the Pro models come with Ultra-Wideband chip for accurate ranging and spatial orientation.
Article Summary: Google Pixel 9 and Pixel 9 Pro will be available for preorder starting August 14 and will go on sale on August 22. The Google Pixel 9 sports a 6.3-inch Super Actua display with a peak brightness of 3,000 nits and 1280 x 2856 pixels resolution. The phone is powered by Google Tensor G4 SoC that is specially designed to handle AI and machine learning tasks.

Article Title: Court: Burger King has "miserably failed" to prove trademark infringement case against Pune restaurant
Article Text:
Court says no to monetary damages to Pune eatery

In a surprising verdict, a Pune district court has dismissed a 13-year-old lawsuit filed by the American fast-food chain Burger King Corporation against a locally-owned eatery with the same name. The US company had accused the Pune-based Burger King of trademark infringement and sought a permanent injunction, damages, and a halt to the use of the name. The court dismissed the lawsuit filed by the Burger King Corporation in 2011, seeking a permanent injunction restraining infringement of trademark.However, the court ruled in favor of the local eatery, stating that it had been operating under the name "Burger King" since 1991-92, well before the US chain entered the Indian market.The plaintiff's first Indian BURGER KING restaurant was opened in New Delhi on November 9, 2014, the court said.The court found no evidence to support Burger King Corporation's claim that customers were confused or misled by the local eatery's use of the name. Additionally, the company failed to prove any actual financial loss due to the alleged infringement. The court said the Burger King Corporation has "miserably failed" to prove that the eatery here had infringed its trademark Burger King while running the restaurant in Pune.Burger King filed the lawsuit against Anahita Irani and Shapoor Irani. The Iranis opposed the suit, saying it was filed with malafide intentions and to discourage business people who are bonafide users and retailers. They said that apart from the name Burger King, there was absolutely no similarity in the plaintiff's trademark and their own shop name.This decision may have implications for trademark disputes involving established local businesses and multinational corporations.The Pune-based restaurant owners had counterclaimed for damages due to the harassment they endured during the lengthy legal battle. They sought Rs 20 lakh as damages. The court, however, refused any monetary relief to them too, noting that apart from oral evidence, no other proof was submitted to substantiate their claims.
Article Summary: Pune court dismisses 13-year-old lawsuit filed by Burger King Corporation. US company accused Pune-based Burger King of trademark infringement. Court ruled in favor of local eatery, saying it had been operating under the name since 1991-92.

Begin by starting the Indian Bike Driving 3D game on your device.

Look for the button featuring a phone icon, typically located at the bottom left corner of the game screen. Click on this icon to open the phone menu.

Within the phone menu, find the handset icon, usually coloured green and positioned in the middle. Click on this icon to proceed.

Upon clicking the handset icon, a contact list will appear on the screen. Look for an icon featuring nine orange circles at the bottom left corner of this screen. Click on it to access the number entry interface.

In the number entry interface, use your device's keypad to input one of the provided cheat codes. Each cheat code corresponds to a specific reward mentioned in the description.

After entering the cheat code, press the confirm or enter button on your device's keypad. This action will immediately grant you the corresponding benefit associated with that cheat code.

Article Title: Vivo V40 with ZEISS co-engineered camera system goes on sale: Price in India, specifications and more
Article Text:
Vivo V40: Price, availability in India

Vivo V40 launch offers

Offline:

6 months of free accidental and liquid damage along with flat 10% instant cashback

12 months zero down payment

Up to 40% off on vivo V-Shield and up to 10% Exchange bonus as part of vivo upgrade programme with SBI, HDFC, Kotak Mahindra, and IDFC First Bank among other partners

Online:

6 months of free accidental and liquid damage along with flat 10% instant cashback

Flat 10% exchange bonus along with up to 6 months no-cost EMI

Vivo V40, V40 Pro: specifications, features

Vivo V40 smartphone is now available for purchase in India. It was launched in the country earlier this month alongside the V40 Pro and comes with ZEISS-style portrait modes as well as the Aura light flash.The V40 is priced at Rs 34,999 for the 8GB + 128GB variant, Rs 36,999 for the 8GB + 256GB variant and Rs 41,999 for the 12GB + 512GB variant. The phone will be available in Ganges Blue, Lotus Purple and Titanium Grey colour variants from Flipkart, Vivo India e-store and all partner retail stores.Launch offers include free accidental and liquid damage protection for six months, cashback options, and various financing schemes, available both online and offline.Vivo V40 sports a 6.78-inch 1.5K AMOLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate and up to 4500 nits peak brightness. The phone is powered by a Snapdragon 7 Gen 3 SoC.The phone comes with ZEISS Co-Engineered Camera System which includes a 50MP main rear camera with OIS and ZEISS optics, complemented by a 50MP ultra-wide camera and a 50MP 2x telephoto portrait camera.The phone also has an IP68 rating for dust and water resistance, packs a 5,500mAh battery with 80W fast charging and runs on Android 14 with Funtouch OS 14. The company has promised three Android updates and four years of security updates for the V40 series.
Article Summary: Vivo V40 is priced at Rs 34,999 for the 8GB + 128GB variant. The phone will be available in Ganges Blue, Lotus Purple and Titanium Grey. Launch offers include free accidental and liquid damage protection for six months, cashback options, and various financing schemes.

Article Title: Cognizant Americas EVP clarifies on Rs 2.5 lakh annual package: Our compensation for engineering graduates is ...
Article Text: IT giant Cognizant has found itself in the crosshairs of social media criticism over its salary packages. The company has clarified that the much-discussed (or rather much-trolled) Rs 2.52 lakh annual salary offer is intended for non-engineering undergraduate degree holders, and not for engineering graduates.Contrary to the online uproar, Cognizant asserts that its starting salary for fresh engineering graduates ranges from Rs 4 lakh to Rs 12 lakh annually, depending on several factors like specialization and certifications.The company has emphasized that its compensation for engineering graduates is competitive with industry standards and even surpasses those of some peers."Our recent job posting for talent from non-engineering backgrounds, with a 3-year undergraduate degree has been grossly misrepresented. This job posting, with compensation of Rs 2.52 lakhs annually, was only for candidates with a 3-year undergraduate degree and not for engineering graduates."Our annual compensation for fresh engineering graduates ranges from Rs 4 lakhs to Rs 12 lakhs annually, depending on the category of hiring, skill set, and advanced industry accredited certifications," said Surya Gummadi, EVP and President, Cognizant Americas ."The compensation we offer for engineering graduates is highly competitive within the IT services peer group," he said. He said Cognizant has been recruiting and upskilling freshers from engineering institutions as well as colleges offering degrees in science, arts, and commerce."We have been recruiting and upskilling freshers from engineering institutions as well as colleges offering degrees in science, arts, and commerce. Today, as AI increasingly powers modern businesses, we are creating new pathways for talent to thrive in India's technology industry," Gummadi further said.Talking of Cognizant's India operation, Gummadi said, "India is the heart of Cognizant and its largest talent hub - with over 70 per cent of its over 3,36,000 global workforce - based in major metros and Tier-2 cities, across the country."
Article Summary: IT giant Cognizant has found itself in the crosshairs of social media criticism over its salary packages. The company has clarified that the much-discussed (or rather much-trolled) Rs 2.52 lakh annual salary offer is intended for non- engineering undergraduate degree holders.
